spatialCoords-setter

Source: R/SpatialExperimentMethods.R
spatialCoords-set-SpatialExperiment-method.Rd

a setter method which sets/replaces the spatial coordinate in a SpatialExperiment class object.

# S4 method for SpatialExperiment
spatialCoords(x) <- value

Arguments

x

a SpatialExperiment class object
value

a DataFrame with the new spatial coordinates to set.

Value

none

Examples

example(SpatialExperiment)

#> 
#> SptlEx> ## building random seqFISH data coordinates
#> SptlEx> fishCoordinates <- data.frame(Cell_ID=paste0("cell",c(1:30)),
#> SptlEx+                 Irrelevant=100,
#> SptlEx+                 x=sample(c(-4000:4000), size=30, replace=TRUE),
#> SptlEx+                 y=sample(c(-4000:4000), size=30, replace=TRUE))
#> 
#> SptlEx> ## building random seqFISH cell labels
#> SptlEx> fishCellLabels <- data.frame(Cell_ID=paste0("cell",c(1:30)),
#> SptlEx+                              class="neuron",
#> SptlEx+                              classID=sample(c(0:5), size=30, replace=TRUE))
#> 
#> SptlEx> ## building random seqFISH count matrix
#> SptlEx> fishCounts <- matrix(sample(0:100, size=(30*30), replace=TRUE),
#> SptlEx+                      nrow=30, ncol=30,
#> SptlEx+                      dimnames=list(paste0("gene",c(1:30)),
#> SptlEx+                                    paste0("cell",c(1:30))))
#> 
#> SptlEx> ## creating SpatialExperiment object
#> SptlEx> se <- SpatialExperiment(rowData=rownames(fishCounts),
#> SptlEx+                         colData=fishCellLabels,
#> SptlEx+                         assays=SimpleList(counts=as.matrix(fishCounts)),
#> SptlEx+                         spatialCoords=fishCoordinates)
fakeFishCoords <- cbind(fishCoordinates[,c(1:3)], fishCoordinates[,3])
        colnames(fakeFishCoords) <- c("MyCell_ID", "Irrelevant", "x", "y")
spatialCoords(se) <- fakeFishCoords
spatialCoords(se)

#> DataFrame with 30 rows and 4 columns
#>       MyCell_ID Irrelevant         x         y
#>     <character>  <numeric> <integer> <integer>
#> 1         cell1        100      2901      2901
#> 2         cell2        100       296       296
#> 3         cell3        100      3137      3137
#> 4         cell4        100     -2020     -2020
#> 5         cell5        100      -190      -190
#> ...         ...        ...       ...       ...
#> 26       cell26        100      -771      -771
#> 27       cell27        100     -2584     -2584
#> 28       cell28        100     -1616     -1616
#> 29       cell29        100     -2384     -2384
#> 30       cell30        100     -2095     -2095
